title: Pears Logo Serif
content:
Hi, looks hand drawn/painted to me, but would greatly appreciate any ideas of what this might be or something similar. Many thanks in advance...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091120215512im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Pears_4021.jpg)
author: Benred

comments.content:
I think you’re right about being hand-drawn, The s’s are tilted slightly and the smaller a is a different shape slightly. If you have any idea how old the design is, you can search for that time period. I would guess 1900s. I have a feeling that P is not going to be easy to find.

- Mike Yanega

It dates from the 1880’s:

[History of ’Bubbles’.](http://web.archive.org/web/20091120215512/http:/www.liverpoolmuseums.org.uk/picture-of-month/displaypicture.asp?venue=7&id=299) No history of the lettering unfortunately.

Nick Cooke
